page.title: 12CROSSING GATES CLAXBY
page.content: Approximately one mile from Claxby village centre there is a railway crossing with gates operated manually. During a 16 hour day for one week the gates are opened as indicated below: Cars 277 Vans 78 Lorries 71 Tractors 25 Motor cycles/scooters 46 Cycles 13 Walkers 12 In the same time the number of trains which passed this point is indicated below: Passenger trains 92 Freight trains 13 Engines 15 When this survey was taken the guards were on strike, which means the freight traffic was down by about two thirds.
